tit.e: Chokushiden (farm developed under the edict of Emperor)

tit.cmt: (farm developed under the edict of the Emperor)すぐ次の行に説明があるので、削除

sen.j: 勅旨田（ちょくしでん）は、古代日本において、天皇の勅旨により開発された田地であり、皇室経済の財源に充てられた。
sen.e: Chokusiden is the farm developed under the edict of Emperor in ancient Japan, it was used to provide funding for the Imperial Household.

sen.j: 勅旨田が設定されたのは平安時代前期の天長・承和年間（820年代～840年代）に集中しており、この時期の開発奨励政策を反映したものと考えられている。
sen.e: Establishment of Chokushiden was concentrated during the period of Tenchou and Shouwa (from 820's to 840's), and it is assumed that it was the outcome of the incentive measure for development during this period.
sen.cmt: 以下の用語を追加しました。天長→Tenchou承和→Shouwa
sen.e: Establishment of Chokushiden was established during the period of Tenchou and Shouwa (from 820's to 840's), and it is assumed to be an incentive measure to spur development during this period.

It was established largely during the Tencho and Showa eras (from the 820s to the 840s) of the early Heian period, and it is assumed to have been intended to serve as an incentive measure to spur development during this period.

sen.j: 勅旨田は、8世紀後期から存在していたが、本格的に設定されたのは9世紀第2四半期に入ってからである。
sen.e: Chokushiden had been existed since the latter half of the eighth century, and the establishment of Chokushiden was enhanced in the second quarter of the ninth century.

sen.j: 810年代のうちは右大臣藤原園人主導のもと、有力貴族・寺社を抑制し貧民救済を重視する政策がとられていた。
sen.e: During 810's, Udaijin (minister of the right), FUJIWARA no Sonohito took the initiative in policies that control powerful peerage and temples, shrines and focus on relief of poor.

sen.j: しかし当時、百姓層の階層分化が進み、貧民層が増加することにより律令制的な人別課税が行き詰まるといった社会情勢の変化が進展していた。
sen.e: However, at that time, change in social situation; individual imposition of taxes based on the laws and ordinance system was stuck due to the increased number of farmer class and poor class, was proceeded.
However, at that time, change in social situation; individual imposition of taxes based on laws and the ordinance system was stuck due to the increased number of farmers and poor class.

At that time, however, Japan was experiencing social change in that the individual imposition of taxes under the Ritsuryo legal system was no longer being enforced due to an increase in the number of the poor and further stratification of the agricultural class.

sen.e: For that reason, FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu who became the leader of the Grand Council of State in around 820 years attempted to respond to the change of the society by implementing the incentive measure for development.

sen.e: One of the incentive measures for development that were enforced in the period of governance under Fuyutsugu was establishment of Chokushiden.

sen.j: 勅旨田は、国衙の管理する正税を開発原資とし、主に空閑地・荒田などに設定され、国司が勅旨田経営を所管した。
sen.e: Chokushiden which was mainly established in vacant land or moorland was funded by shozei (the rice tax stored in provincial offices' warehouse) managed by the provincial governor's office, and the management of Chokushiden was under jurisdiction of the provincial governor.

sen.j: 勅旨田は不輸租とされ、その収益は皇室経済に充てられた。
sen.e: Chokushiden was regarded as an exemption from tax, and the profit from Chokushiden was funded for Imperial Household economy.

sen.j: 天長年間（824年-834年）に勅旨田の設定が急増し、次の承和年間（834年-847年）も多くの勅旨田が設定されている。
sen.e: During the period of Tenchou (824-834), the number of established Chokushiden increased rapidly, and a large number of Chokushiden were established in the period of Shouwa (834-847).

sen.j: 勅旨田の設定地は全国に及んでおり、例えば史料からは、下野、武蔵、美濃、摂津、備前、肥前などに設定例が検出される。
sen.e: The established land of Chokushiden was across the country; the established Chokushiden was identified in Shimotsuke Province, Musashi Province, Mino Province, Settsu Province, Bizen Province, and Hizen Province according to historical materials.

sen.j: 天長・承和期の淳和天皇と仁明天皇の治世は、学問が興隆し、後世の故実ともなった宮廷儀式が確立するなど、王朝文化が花開いた時期であるが、これらは勅旨田収入に支えられたものと考えられている。
sen.e: In the reign of Emperor Junna and Emperor Ninmyo in Tenchou and Shouwa period, a royal court culture was in bloom with academics flourished as well as the establishment of court ceremony that would be a practice in later ages, which was supported by the income from Chokushiden.

sen.e: However, when the reign of Emperor Montoku came after Emperor Ninmyo passed away in 850, Chokushiden was not established anymore.

sen.j: 10世紀初頭に律令制回帰を志向する藤原時平が太政官首班に就き、902年に発布された延喜の荘園整理令により、勅旨田の新設は禁止されることとなり、以後、勅旨田は次第に見られなくなった。
sen.e: In the early tenth century, FUJIWARA no Tokihira who was oriented to return to laws and ordinance system took a post at the leader of the Grand Council of State, and Chokushiden gradually disappeared after prohibiting Chokushiden from being newly established in accordance with the Decree Restricting the Expansion of Private Estates in Engi era that was promulgated in 902.
